security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill containing only documentation and code examples. No executable code, network calls, file system access, or environment variable reading. The process.env references in examples are documentation only.

content.user_title: Handle blockchain RPC errors and transactions
content.value_statement: Blockchain development involves complex error handling, gas estimation, and transaction management. This skill provides battle-tested patterns to prevent lost funds, failed transactions, and race conditions.
actual_capabilities: Guide RPC error handling with try/catch patterns
Recommend gas estimation with buffer calculations
Verify multicall safety with allowFailure flags
Implement nonce management for concurrent transactions
Provide rate limiting and retry logic examples
limitations: Does not execute blockchain transactions or interact with networks directly
Does not provide live gas prices or RPC endpoint recommendations
Cannot validate or deploy smart contracts

use_cases.title: Secure contract interactions
use_cases.description: Learn to wrap all contract calls in try/catch and handle reverts gracefully to prevent application crashes.

use_cases.title: Optimize gas usage
use_cases.description: Apply gas estimation with buffer and EIP-1559 pricing patterns to reduce failed transactions and save costs.

use_cases.title: Scale multi-chain support
use_cases.description: Configure chain-specific RPC endpoints and manage nonces across multiple concurrent transactions.

prompt_templates.title: Handle contract call errors
prompt_templates.prompt: I have a contract call that is failing. Show me how to properly wrap it in try/catch and handle execution reverted errors gracefully.

prompt_templates.title: Estimate gas for swap
prompt_templates.prompt: I need to estimate gas for a Uniswap swap transaction. Show me the correct pattern with buffer and EIP-1559 gas pricing.

prompt_templates.title: Batch token data fetching
prompt_templates.prompt: I want to fetch quotes for 50 tokens using multicall. How do I use allowFailure: true to prevent one failure from breaking the batch?

prompt_templates.title: Manage concurrent transactions
prompt_templates.scenario: Sending multiple transactions from same address
prompt_templates.prompt: I need to send 5 transactions concurrently from the same wallet. How do I manage nonces to avoid race conditions and out-of-order execution?

output_examples.input: How do I handle a contract call that keeps failing with 'execution reverted'?
output: Wrap the call in try/catch and check for 'execution reverted' specifically
Return null instead of throwing to allow processing other tokens
Log the error for debugging but continue execution
Example pattern: if (error.message.includes('execution reverted')) return null;

best_practices: Always wrap contract calls in try/catch blocks since low-liquidity and non-existent pools WILL fail
Add 10-20% buffer to gas estimates to account for state changes between estimation and execution
Use allowFailure: true in multicall calls so individual failures do not break the entire batch
anti_patterns: Unwrapped contract calls that crash the entire application on a single pool failure
Sending transactions without estimating gas first, leading to inevitable reverts
Using a single static nonce for concurrent transactions, causing out-of-order execution and errors

faq.question: Which blockchains does this skill support?
faq.answer: The patterns apply to all EVM-compatible chains including Ethereum, Polygon, Arbitrum, and Optimism.

faq.question: What gas buffer should I use?
faq.answer: Use 10-20% buffer. Higher for volatile networks, lower for stable ones with predictable gas prices.

faq.question: How many confirmations do I need?
faq.answer: Recommended: 2 for Ethereum, 5+ for faster chains like Polygon or Arbitrum. Higher for larger values.

faq.question: Is my RPC URL secure when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only provides patterns. Your RPC configuration stays in your local environment.

faq.question: Why do my multicall transactions fail?
faq.answer: Missing allowFailure: true causes the entire multicall to fail if any individual call reverts.

faq.question: How does this compare to other blockchain SDKs?
faq.answer: This skill provides low-level patterns that work with any SDK. SDKs like ethers and viem handle some patterns automatically.
